item.title: PXE Booting Runbook
item.description: PXE Booting Runbook PXE booting is a key component of a working Shasta system. There are a lot of different components involved, which increases the complexity. This guide runs through the most common issues and shows what is needed in order to have a successful PXE boot. NCNs on install ncn-m001 on reboot or NCN boot 2.1. Verify DHCP packets can be forwarded from the workers to the MTL network (VLAN1)

item.title: Interpreting Hms Health Check Results
item.description: Interpreting HMS Health Check Results Table of contents: Introduction HMS Smoke Tests HMS Functional Tests Additional Troubleshooting Install Blocking vs. Non-Blocking Failures Introduction This document describes how to interpret the results of the HMS Health Check scripts and techniques for troubleshooting when failures occur. HMS Smoke Tests The HMS smoke tests consist of bash scripts that check the status of HMS service pods and jobs in Kubernetes and verify HTTP status codes returned by the HMS service APIs.

item.title: Manual SSH Key Setting Process
item.description: Manual SSH Key Setting Process If for whatever reason this script fails, SSH keys can be set manually using the following process: Save the public SSH key for the root user. ncn# export SCSD_SSH_KEY=$(cat /root/.ssh/id_rsa.pub | sed 's/[[:space:]]*$//') If a different SSH key is to be used (for example from conman) set the SCSD_SSH_KEY environment variable to that key value. Generate a System Configuration Service configuration via the scsd tool.

item.title: Running Ct Tests Manually
item.description: Running CT Tests Manually To run the tests manually: ncn# /opt/cray/tests/ncn-resources/hms/hms-test/hms_run_ct_smoke_tests_ncn-resources.sh Examine the output. If one or more failures occur, investigate the cause of each failure. See the interpreting_hms_health_check_results documentation for more information. Otherwise, run the HMS functional tests. ncn# /opt/cray/tests/ncn-resources/hms/hms-test/hms_run_ct_functional_tests_ncn-resources.sh Examine the output. If one or more failures occur, investigate the cause of each failure. See the interpreting_hms_health_check_results documentation for more information.

item.title: Troubleshoot The Cms Barebones Image Boot Test
item.description: Troubleshoot the CMS Barebones Image Boot Test Verify that the CSM services needed to boot a node are available and working properly. This section describes how the barebonesImageTest script works and how to interpret the results. If the script is unavailable, the manual steps for reproducing the barebones image boot test are provided. Topics 1. Steps the Script Performs 2. Controlling Which Node Is Used 3.
